fields.description:
Several of the Jelly examples include the comment tag:
<!- other jelly tags ->

If the example is run as listed it will produce an error:
Exception: java.io.IOException: expected '=', got 'j'
java.io.PrintWriter@3aecf2e6

If it is changed to:
<!-- other jelly tags -->

Then the examples work fine.
fields.summary: Jelly Documentation - error in comment tags

fields.description:
The guide to installing JIRA on MySQL/Linux at:

http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.11/mysql-guide-linux.html

should really be in the JIRA space on confluence.atlassian.com, as it's not documenting JIRA as much as a particular setup. It's not linked from the menu for this reason.
fields.summary: Move mysql-guide-linux.html page to Confluence

fields.description:
Very slow response every time I visit the issue navigator or an individual issue on JAC. I've attached a screenshot from Firebug with the load times and a sample URL.

It seems like there are two problems:

- my browser should be caching the Javascript forever based on the Expires header
- the response includes a Connection: Close header, which prevents keep-alives. This means the browser opens a new connection for each request.

The second problem could be due to the mod_caucho connector in Apache. We've seen this before when keep-alives were enabled on Confluence at Contegix.
fields.summary: Page loads slow on JAC

fields.description:
Internet Explorer 7 added support for displaying RSS feeds - http://www.microsoft.com/windows/IE/ie7/tour/rss/. Prior to version 7, and RSS feed in IE was displayed as raw XML.

However, RSS feeds from JIRA are displayed in still displayed in Internet Explorer 7 as raw XML. Confluence feeds (and other public feeds) appear correctly in IE 7.

See the attached screenshots of RSS feeds in IE 7:
- from http://jira.atlassian.com (raw XML)
- from http://confluence.atlassian.com
- from Google News
fields.summary: RSS feeds from JIRA are displayed in Internet Explorer 7 as raw XML
Document adding in-page template replies for JIRA comment field using GreaskMonkey

fields.description:
The "Watch it" and "Vote for it" operation links should be more closely associated with the Issue Details. If these two links were right beside the (View) links, all watching and voting operations would be in one location and would thus be more intuitive.

The (very crude) mockup shows the positioning I am describing.
fields.summary: Add "Watch it" and "Vote For it" toggles next to totals

fields.description:
I managed to reproduce this problem in JIRA v3.11. Here is the steps to reproduce:

1) Create a username with  # character like #tester 
2) Login as #tester user
3) On the view issue screen,  clicked on the "Assign to me" link as shown in the attachment  [screenshot|^sample.PNG]

It displayed the "assign issue" screen instead of  assign the issue directly to the user with username #tester as shown in attachment [screenshot|^error.PNG].
fields.summary: Username with # character breaks on "Assign to me" operation

If you don't have any groups you shouldn't show up in the user picker.

fields.description:
Users may not be able to see certain issues in the IssueNavigator, if they create an issue level security, where the permission depends on a user custom field where the customfield does not have a searcher set.  Browsing the issue directly, works fine, however when running a search the issue wont be displayed.  The problem is basically that when running a search, permission checks are carried out against the index.  In order for this permission check to work if the issue security level depends on a user custom field, then the value of that customfield needs to be indexed.  This however only happens if a searcher has been set for the customfield.

The boolean permissions query being constructed may look something like this (depending on the groups a user may be in):
{noformat}
issue_security_level:-1 (+(+issue_security_level:10000 +(customfield_10000:jira-users customfield_10000:jira-developers))) 
{noformat}

If {{customfield_10000}} does not exist in the indexed documents (which will be the case if no searcher has been defined) then this query will always return false.

The workaround for this is to set a searcher for your customfield and and reindex JIRA.

In the long run we'll have to fix this by either:
# Indexing user custom fields always (regardless if a searcher has been set or not)
# Not allow users to remove a searcher for a user customfield that's being used as a permission.  Similarly not allow users to add a user customfield as a permission without a searcher.
# When the permission lucene query is being constructed, query the DB directly if the user customfield has not been indexed.
fields.summary: Issues not shown in issue navigator that a user has permission for according to the issue security level

fields.description:
The Crowd libraries in JIRA need updating to get around an error found with XFire http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/XFIRE-888

This should mean the following for JIRA's parent pom.

{code:xml}
<dependency>
  <artifactId>wstx-asl</artifactId>
  <groupId>woodstox</groupId>
  <version>3.2.0</version>
  <properties>
    <war.bundle>true</war.bundle>
  </properties>
</dependency>
<dependency>
  <artifactId>xfire-all</artifactId>
  <groupId>org.codehaus.xfire</groupId>
  <version>1.2.6</version>
  <properties>
    <war.bundle>true</war.bundle>
  </properties>
</dependency>
{code}
fields.summary: Move the XFire dependency for Crowd from 1.2.1 to 1.2.6

fields.description: Say I have a project with key SUPPORT, and an issue type "Support". Currently if you do a quicksearch for "SUPPORT", you'll get issues of type "Support", rather than issues in project SUPPORT.
fields.summary: In quicksearch, issue type has higher priority than project key

fields.description: When you select a scheme from the 'workflow schemes' page, the text says: "On this page you can edit the workflows for the "Fixed-To-Live" workflow scheme.".  If the workflow scheme is active, it should rather say something like "You cannot edit this workflow scheme because it's active."
fields.summary: shouldn't say you can edit active workflow schemes when you can't

fields.description:
Called the method _addWorklogAndAutoAdjustRemainingEstimate_ via soap service, however the soap server response with this type of format IssueServiceImpl$RemoteWorklogImpl. For the details, please see the attachment file of SOAP service request and response

{quote}
From this comment, [JRA-13698|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-13698#action_92500]
I really need to remove this '$' character. I did notice in the first release of 3.10.1 that the WSDL contained this character for worklogs
{quote}
Unfortunately, I do not see '$' character contained in WSDL file of  JIRA version 3.10.1. This is the details of the WSDL operation

{code:xml}
      <wsdl:operation name="addWorklogAndAutoAdjustRemainingEstimate" parameterOrder="in0 in1 in2">
         <wsdl:input message="impl:addWorklogAndAutoAdjustRemainingEstimateRequest" name="addWorklogAndAutoAdjustRemainingEstimateRequest"/>
         <wsdl:output message="impl:addWorklogAndAutoAdjustRemainingEstimateResponse" name="addWorklogAndAutoAdjustRemainingEstimateResponse"/>
         <wsdl:fault message="impl:RemotePermissionException" name="RemotePermissionException"/>
         <wsdl:fault message="impl:RemoteException" name="RemoteException"/>
         <wsdl:fault message="impl:RemoteValidationException" name="RemoteValidationException"/>
      </wsdl:operation>
{code}
fields.summary: Call method addWorklogAndAutoAdjustRemainingEstimate, the soap server reponse with this type IssueServiceImpl$RemoteWorklogImpl

fields.summary: investigate/improve MS SQL Server setup instructions
Remove case sensitivity from Group Names when searching

fields.description:
Some organisations require the option to switch all mission-critical applications to an offsite backup in the event that the primary instance goes down. Please document the basics of setting this up:

1. Install JIRA to a backup server using a development key that is not running
2. Setup a load balancer front end that can test if JIRA is responsive on the primary and backup servers
3. Setup a database backup system that transfers the database contents to the backup server database, eg nightly or hourly
4. Setup a script so that the load balancer will start the backup instance, stop the periodic database transfers and redirect requests in the event that the primary goes down

If there's a better method then we should document that instead.
fields.summary: Document maintaining an offsite backup instance for failover

fields.description:
Username must be created in lowercase in JIRA. 

At the moment, JIRA allows the username with the lowercase or uppercase letter in Login and Add Watcher pages. It should restrict the case-sensitive when the username is request from the login page or convert it to lower case.  JIRA should have this validation rather than allowing the database to take control in the case sensitive conversion.
fields.summary: Username upper case are not being restricted in some pages
improve Linux installation instructions

The link currently points here: http://www.perldoc.com/perl5.8.0/pod/perlre.html  ('Server not found')

Maybe it should point here instead? http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.4.2/docs/api/java/util/regex/Pattern.html#sum
fields.summary: broken link on the 'Trackback Settings' screen
Confusing "The 'Project Information' panel is not available" message when fields are disabled
Adding Greek support in Full-Text search

fields.description:
Safari 3 on Leopard has a bug where it adds a {{Content-Type: multipart/form-data; boundary=----WebKitFormBoundaryiSYJ0Lax1tMirv7S}} request header to a  HTTP GET, following the re-direct after creating an issue.  JIRA's multipart library can't handle this as it is not part of the HTTP spec, and it doesn't make sense to include this header in a HTTP GET.  

As a result, users see the following error:
HTTP Status 404 - No view for result [error] exists for action [ViewIssue]

We may provide a patch for our multipart library if this starts to affect a lot of users, however it is ultimately a bug in Safari.
fields.summary: Can't create issue in Safari 3 on Leopard

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-13790].
  {panel}

I am a user of Jira because I use Jetbrain's Jira (3.10 Enterprise b#260). I only use Jetbrains's IDEA product, but they have many more products that are listed in Jira.

The problem I have with Quick Search is that it shows issues across all projects, it shows issues with all statuses.
Eventually I just got fed up with it and created a filter "IDEA Search Template" which has the projects, status, and resolution fields preset with a search term "ChangeThisXYZ". So, now what I do is click on "IDEA Search Template", then click Edit filter, then change the filter text, and then click View to see the jiras.

This got me thinking that maybe the Quick Search could just allow you to set a search filter as the default settings for the Quick Search. The Quick Search would use all the settings in the filter except for the query string. The query string would still be taken from the quick search textbox.
fields.summary: Quick Search should allow filter settings to be configurable.

fields.description:
When you use the user autopicker by typing in the users name, and if the name ISN'T in the JIRA system you get a "FALSE" rendering below the user selection field and your Update/Cancel buttons disappear.  This happens on several pages of the "Add/Edit" user, however one that I can reproduce it on regularly is "Edit/Add Component Users".

See the screenshot for the false reading.
fields.summary: User name AutoPicker renders a "FALSE" and pushbuttons disappear.

fields.description:
Hi,

I am developing a plug-in for my Jira aaplication & encountered a problem related to checkbox display.

In my atlassian-plugin.xml, I added below entry - 
<properties>
        <property>
    	<key>timeBurnDown</key>
                    <name>report.burndown.type.label.time</name>
	<description>report.burndown.type.description.time</description>
	 <type>checkbox</type>
      </property>
</properties>

I found that the key i.e "timeBurnDown" was being displayed on - configurereport.jsp(see the attachment), which is basically my input screen for plugin.
I looked into the issue & found that in the objectconfiguration_form.jsp, you have to remove two lines(71,72)
  <webwork:property value="." />
    <webwork:property value="paramValue(.)" />
When I removed these entries the my problem got solved.

Please let me know if my fix is correct or not.
Regards,
Abhishek
fields.summary: Plugin input page is showing <key> values

fields.description:
A user reported that they were unable to import their Bugzilla content across to JIRA using the Bugzilla importer tool due to an error. The error turned out to be caused by a corrupt Bugzilla database - running the Bugzilla Sanity Check over their database fixed the problem.

See http://www.bugzilla.org/features/#sanity for detail on the tool.

Please update http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.4.3/bugzilla_import.html to mention to users either to always run the Sanity Check before importing, or possibly only in the event of an error.
fields.summary: Update Bugzilla import guide to ask users to run Bugzilla 'Sanity Check' tool first

fields.description: It would be really useful to have the ability to hide old components from users. Some components we have in our DB are no longer in use but are valuable for searching old issues. Currently I have to put an X in front of the component to move it to the end of the list, or delete it *which I don't do*.
fields.summary: Ability to hide components which are  no longer in use

fields.description: In the screen *Assign Groups to Project Role: Developers*, I have a group already in the Developer Project Role called *CFI Data Warehouse & Plumbing Team*.  If I click on the hyperlink for that group name, an error message appears saying *No group CFI Data Warehouse found. The group does not exist. Please try another.*  (Note that the error message truncates the Group Name just before the ampersand).
fields.summary: Hyperlinks to Group Names containing an ampersand (&) fail

fields.description: It would be very useful to have a feature that sends an email to a user as the due date approaches.  For example, to notify the assignee and the project lead that a task is due in 2 hours.  If this is already a feature that requires some configuration, I have not managed to find a way to do it, so some documentation would be very helpful.
fields.summary: Send reminder email before due date

fields.summary: java.lang.NullPointerException at com.atlassian.jira.propertyset.JiraCachingPropertySet.exists(JiraCachingPropertySet.java:386)

fields.description: A possibility to bulk download attachments would be handy. Our JIRA issues sometimes have many jpg attachments that need to be viewed externally. Downloading one by one is very time consuming. Bulk download as a zip file would be acceptable.
fields.summary: Bulk download of attachment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-13776].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Each time users that send emails to a designated mailbox from which Jira retrieves them in order to create new tickets or add comments to existing ones usually contain footers with company's logos, marketing imagery or some standard text. All these attachments are autiomatically added to tickets into file attachments therefore cluttering important content.

Assume the following scenario:
1. New issue created from an e-mail message (HTML) and image attachment added to the issue
2. above issue.is commented from the reply e-mail
Result: the images from original part of message are attached once again.

With long correspondence the amount of duplicated images becomes VERY big.
 

h3. Suggested Solution
Could we have an option to create filters or a new option in Jira's ticket that allows to remove existing and ignore future content or attachments files in newly retrieved messages? Ideally in files attachments one would click option and select "Remove and ignore" or have a dedicated feature to manageme ignored files and text content that is being removed for each email message going into JIRA. This could be global, per project or even per ticket etc.
fields.summary: Duplicate attachments created from images inserted to HTML e-mails when comments added from follow-up messages

fields.description:
Description:
1.Open for edit Jira bug

Actual:
Update button is enable

Expected:
Update button is disable,user did no changes
fields.summary: Update button is enable in JIRA when user did no changes

fields.description:
We are using JIRA for tracking issues in Hungarian. There are special characters in our language, that can be captured in the summary field, however not always correctly displayed. For example if I'm looking at a result fo a filter, the summary text displayed correctly, when I'm looking at the details of a bug, the accents are missing. e.g. Ő is converted to o, or ű is converted to u.

I think it should be some bug, as somewhere it is correct, elsewhere it is not.
fields.summary: Hungarian accents are not correctly displayed in summary field: őű

fields.description:
Hi,

actually we are using the confluence wiki syntax in jira comments, which looks very nice. But now I will use the wiki syntax also in the description of projects.

But JIRA renders this as plain text only.
fields.summary: project description doesn't support wiki sysntax
"Printable" icon only print the "first" tab view in the Edit Issue Screen

fields.description:
Sequence:
* Manveer can't remember his password, so hits 'forgot password'
* Password arrives in inbox
* However new password doesn't work
* I try, and confirm not working
* I manually set password in admin
fields.summary: "Forgot Password" on JAC doesn't actually reset password

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-13768].
  {panel}

When we resolve an issue, we want the Assignee field to select the reporter by default, but allow the resolver to select another user.  Currently the Assignee field defaults to the currently assigned user, usually the resolver.  This is never the correct value for this field during a Resolve transition.

When we reopen an issue, we want the Assignee field to select the last assigned user.  I note there is already a request for this functionality.

Our plan is to install a Post Function that assigns the issue to the Reporter, and remove the Assignee field from the resolve screen.  This is less than ideal.   We have no simple solution for re-opened issues.

What I'd really like is some kind of pre-function that can alter values to be displayed on the web form without yet touching the underlying database.  Seems like this would allow for a wide variety of customizable transition behaviors and resolve a lot of bugs in this database.
fields.summary: Default values for fields during a transition
Provide text formatting capability

fields.description:
Repro steps:
1) Create a bunch of versions
2) Iterate through them with SOAP or some other method that exposes the sequence numbers.
2a) Note that the sequence numbers are consecutive
3) Delete a version from the middle of the list
4) Repeat step 2
4a) Note that the sequence numbers skip the deleted version's number

When sequence numbers don't correspond to the actual array index, inserting new versions does not work as expected.  The sequence as used by the SOAP method addVersion is the array index.

Expected result:
a) Deleting a version compacts the sequence numbers for versions past it
-or-
b) Inserting a version through SOAP uses the sequence fields rather than the array index
fields.summary: Deleting a version can leave gaps in the version sequence

fields.description:
1. German special letters named "Umlaut" (e.g. 'ä') cause non well formed XML-Exportfiles.
I have opened such file with XML Spy which validates the XML structure and shows an error message (please see red circles at attached screenshot).

2.  Escaped letters are exported with 'amp' (please see blue circles at attached screenshot).
For example(blanks used for better view): 'ä' is exported as '& a m p ; x E 4 ;' but normally it should be '& x E 4 ;'. Also by '& a m p ; q u o t ;' and '& a m p ; l t ;'  ...
I plan to use the (unmodified) exported files to generate PDF files via XSL-FO. Now I have problems with the exported escape sequences.
fields.summary: JIRA - XML-Export - escaped german letters

fields.description:
When you use the SOAP API, the values returned by JIRA are always in English. 
For example:
- (getIssueTypes) RemoteIssueType#getName
- (getPriorities) RemotePriority#getName

Can these be returned in Japanese if the system default language is set to Japanese?

//

Also, another related question - if you use (getProjectRoleActors), it requires the requesting user to have administrator privileges. Is it possible to override this validation, since the client application being developed by a customer requires any user to be able to retrieve a list of project role actors. Please advise.
fields.summary: Values returned over SOAP are always in English

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-13763].
  {panel}

Hi,

please imagine the following scenario:

You create an issue with some subtasks in project A. Then you clone it with all subtasks and move the clone to project B. 

Some time later you create a new subtask for the issue in project A.  If you now want the new subtask in the clone too, then there's quite a lot to do because you can't move a subtask to another project.
What can be done is: clone the subtask. Convert it to a normal issue. Move it. Change to subtask. This ist quite a lot to do for such a simple action.

It would be really helpful to move subtask directly to another project because we need that very often.

Cheers and thx,
Irene
fields.summary: Allow to move subtask to parent in a different project

fields.description: JIRA's AJAX user picker does not search on anything after the @ sign in user email addresses. For instance, typing "atlassian.com" does not bring up a list of users with *@atlassian.com email addresses as I'd expect. This is very annoying, as often I know the company, and hence domain name of the person I'm after.
fields.summary: AJAX find-as-you-type user picker doesn't find domain part of email address
Adding or removing a user to/from the Watchers list of an issue should cause a change history entry

fields.description: The AssignToLead post function should check if the component lead has the "Assignable" permission before adding the user as the assignee
fields.summary: AssignToLead/AssignToReporter post function should check the "Assignable" permission

fields.description: We are using JIRA Enterprise Edition with the global default language 'German'. If a user changes his language settings back to English, he still gets the time estimates in the time tracking area of the issue screen in German, e.g. '1 Tag, 4 Stunden' instead of '1 day, 4 hours'.
fields.summary: Translation of time tracking estimates not working
Insert also the subtasks in the release notes
Issue Linking docs out of date

fields.description: When following a permalink to view a specific comment in Jira it would nice if the comment was highlighted (like Confluence does). This would help identifying the linked comment when it does not appear right at the top of the page because the page is not long enough.
fields.summary: Permalinked work log highlighting

fields.description: The help link in the browse projects screen in the admin section references the version management page in the docs.  This should really only be linked from the manage versions table, as it doesn't make much sense on the browse projects screen.
fields.summary: Help link in browse projects page references version management page in the documentation

fields.description:
When we selected date by calendar in russian dashboard, we couldn't create issue withe the error "incorrect date", because it set the month's names in english.
If we set date manually and change the english month's names with the russian (15/oct/07->15/окт/07) - everything seems quite good.
fields.summary: Can't set `due date` field if language set to Russian: error was

fields.description:
Instead of showing the option to view the watchers or voters for an issue after the link as "Votes 2 (View)", put the link on the actual value and remove the (View) text, eg just "Votes: 2".

Votes:  	 0  (View)
Watchers: 	0  (View)

should be

Votes:  	 0  
Watchers: 	0

If there are no votes/watches, the values should just be rendered as a text-only 0. If there are votes/watches, the link should be on the number.
fields.summary: Clean View Issue page by moving (View) links for voters and watchers to link on actual value

fields.description:
Users should have the option to hide specific empty fields and panels when configuring their screen. This might be accomplished by adding a 'Hide if empty' checkbox column to the table for the Configure Screen page shown on http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.11/fieldscreens.html

This will allow users to hide fields that are infrequently used. If any fields are hidden, the page should then display an option to AJAX-show all hidden fields.
fields.summary: Provide option to 'hide whole field when empty' on Configure Screen

fields.description:
The issue navigator advising "Displaying issues X to Y of Z matching issues" is redundant when there is only one page of hits. When a filter returns under 50 issues, it would be smarter to instead just say "Z matching issues" 

For example, "Displaying issues 1 to 5 of 5 matching issues" should be  "5 matching issues"
fields.summary: When filter returns under 50 issues, show "Z matching issues" instead of "Displaying issues X to Y of Z matching issues"

fields.description:
Clean up the top toolbar by changing 

User: John Doe  [Filters] | [History] | [Profile] | [Log Out]

To instead be

User: [John Doe] | [History] | [Logout]

By moving the Profile to link on the username and removing the common filters link. If users want to view their filters, they can put them on their dashboard as a portlet and still visit them in the same number of clicks by going to Home instead.
fields.summary: Clean up top toolbar by moving Profile link to username and removing Filters link

fields.description: We need to be able to handle per issue permission checks, if no issue security level has been set.  The problem is that if no issue level security is set, -1 gets indexed.  The permissions code however expects a null value.
fields.summary: IssueLevelSecurity permission check does not work with a DocumentIssueImpl if no security level has been set.

fields.description:
Currently, the permlinks rendered for work log items (and in some cases the permlinks for comments as well) do not specify which tab panel should be active when the user visits the page. The active tab panel is stored in the user's session, and so if the last viewed tab panel was the work log tab panel, then the permlink will work correctly. If however the last viewed tab panel was *not* the work log tab panel, or if the user is not currently logged in when they visit the permlink (when receiving the link in a feed/email, for example), they will not be shown the desired work log item.

The default tab panel when the user begins their session is the comments tab panel, which is why the comments permlinks have been "working" up until now, but they should also be fixed to explicitly set the tab panel being viewed in their link, in case the default panel changes in the future.
fields.summary: Permlink-ing of work log items is broken

fields.description:
When bulk moving issues, the following warning appears: "Please note that 3 sub-task issues were removed from the selection and do not appear in the table below. You are not allowed bulk move sub-task issues together with their parent issue."

That should probably say "You are not allowed *to* bulk move sub-task issues..."
fields.summary: minor grammatical error in bulk move

fields.description:
The current Italian translation for "Road Map" is "Mappa", which doesn't mean anything (well, it just mean "Map").

The correct Italian translation for road map is just "Road Map" (it's a commonly used term, there is no better translation) :)
fields.summary: Bad italian translation for "road map"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-13739].
  {panel}

Standard fields in predefined panels are grouped logically, not alphabetically.
Custom field cannot be organized the same way.

They go in alphabetical order (see screenshot) which is not convenient -
- *Closed User* field goes before *Resolution User*
- *Last ... Date* fields are in the middle of the panel, mixed closed and resolution dates together
- *Participants* are not where are want to see this field
fields.summary: Option to define order of custom fields in filter panel

fields.description:
Please modify JIRA's workflow editor to allow admins to add multiple instances of the Fire Event  post-function.
There are cases when firing multiple events from a transition would be useful.

Administrators now have to export the workflows to XML, modify the XML and import it back in order to achieve this. 
It is very cumbersome.
fields.summary: Make Fire Event post-function non-unique

fields.description:
as of now, if a custom event is created in Administration / Events, it appears automatically in all Notification schemes even if the event is not used (handled) in a notification scheme.

This may be annoying. It should be possible instead to add / remove custom events to / from notification schemes depending on the need.
fields.summary: Custom events not to appear automatically in all notification schemes

fields.description:
All text fields in tickets (as used by in support.atlassian.com, jira.atlassian.com) that can be long should wrap. When some fields (like Environment) are too long, it stretches the whole page too far right which makes comments to hard to read.

Unlike http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-7711 , this issue occurs even when the environment field contains spaces such that the text would normally wrap in a table unless specifically told not to.
fields.summary: All fields in tickets (as used by in support.atlassian.com, jira.atlassian.com) that can be long should be wrapped

fields.description:
Please do not mark this as a duplicate: I am not talking about setting remaining estimate to zero. 

I would like to be able to change the remaining time for an issue as part of a project management review of the remaining issues. In otherwords, not as part of logging work, but as part of a general housekeeping/restimation process. I would like to be able to change the new estimate to any value including zero, without having to fill in the 'time spent' value. I used to be able to do this in 3.7, and I can't do it since upgrading to 3.11.

We are using JIRA as a PM tool a great deal, and this new feature of work logging is quite disruptive.
fields.summary: I should be able to change the remaining estimate without logging work done
Include a select all button or check box in custom fields' screens choosing

fields.description:
The issue navigator will breaks when sorting the work ratio because the time spent contains the negative values . After that the following error message shown:
{noformat}
org.apache.jasper.JasperException: For input string: "0-100"
at org.apache.jasper.servlet.JspServletWrapper.handleJspException(JspServletWrapper.java:512)
at org.apache.jasper.servlet.JspServletWrapper.service(JspServletWrapper.java:395)
at org.apache.jasper.servlet.JspServlet.serviceJspFile(JspServlet.java:314)
at org.apache.jasper.servlet.JspServlet.service(JspServlet.java:264)
{noformat}
fields.summary: Issue Navigator breaks if time spents contains negative value while sorting the work ratio

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-13730].
  {panel}

If one wants to configure JIRA with a POP3/IMAP mailbox first he needs to define the connection in Mail Servers providing (mailService.gif):
  	
- The name of this server within JIRA.	
- The host name of your POP / IMAP server.
- The username used to authenticate your POP / IMAP account.

and finally he needs to navigate to Services and specify if the communication is SSL or not (jiraService.gif). Where I believe this option is an integral part of the mail server configuration rather that the jira service.
fields.summary: POP3/IMAP server configuration should be done in one page
Version Workload and Time Tracking Reports should include options for showing Resolved/Unresolved and Complete/Incomplete issues

fields.description:
If the Log Work Done issue operation plugin (that is shipped with JIRA) is disabled, then the Log Work link on the view issue page disappears for everybody. This caused some support hassles.

If the Log Work Done issue operation is disabled we should add a warning on the Time Tracking page.
fields.summary: Add a warning on the Time tracking page if the Log Work Issue operation is disabled

fields.description:
*Use Case:* A user makes a request to application A. To complete this request, A needs to retrieve information from application B with that user's credentials.

*Example:* The JIRA Issues Macro in Confluence currently can only show issues that are public (available to all users) or to a specific user/password encoded in plain-text in the macro's issue URL. Instead, we want to pass the name of the user viewing the page containing the macro to JIRA and then show all issues that user can see.

We need a secure way to pass a user's credentials around between applications. As the password is not stored, passing that around is not an option. Using Crowd, or any other SSO solution, the user's SSO token can be passed around, but we need a solution that works when not under SSO as well.

In short this involves creating trusted relationships between applications. For instance, a Confluence administrator requests a trusted connection from it to JIRA. The JIRA URL is entered and a conversation is initiated that involves a key exchange, then a JIRA administrator is required to authorise the Confluence application as trusted. Confluence is then notified that it is a trusted application, and any requests from it will contain special headers containing encrypted information identifying the application, the user and the time of the request (to stop replay attacks). The requested application should have several options to specify the security levels required such as net-mask (to tie the requesting application to a specific IP or range), time-out (for replay attacks) and secure key exchange (eg. only over HTTPS).

Note: it is anticipated this is a core Atlassian component, but individual applications will need to provide client and server facilities like key persistence and configuration user-interface.
fields.summary: Trusted Applications: Support Authentication Context Passing from Confluence or another Application to JIRA

fields.description: When following a permalink to view a specific comment in Jira it would nice if the comment was highlighted (like Confluence does). This would help identifying the linked comment when it does not appear right at the top of the page because the page is not long enough.
fields.summary: Permalinked comment highlighting

fields.description:
The calendar popup doesn't work in several languages.  It fails with a javascript error, stating that the 'weekend' property is not defined.  The following languages are affected by this:
* af - Afrikaans
* du - Dutch
* el - Greek
* fi - Finnish
* hr - Croatian
* ja, jp - Japanese
* ko - Korean
* si - Sinhalese
* sk - Slovak
* sv - Swedish
* tr - Turkish
fields.summary: Caledar popup doesn't work in several languages

when i place a comment using the Comment button the mail wil be send.
fields.summary: bug in mailnotification

fields.description:
Hi JIRA team,

We faced with a significant problem in JIRA.  When we create a new email by Lotus Notes mail client  then enclose an image to the mail body (we can view it in the letter) and try to create or comment jira issue as the result JIRA fails to attach the image to the issue. But if the image is attached to the letter then everything goes smoothly.
We did the same procedure using Microsoft Outlook client - all works fine when the img was attached to the letter and inserted to the body. 
I want to make stress on this problem because a lot of jira users on our side use LN and this problem greatly affects our work.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards,
Maxim Dyuzhinov 
Deutsche Bank Development Centre
LUXOFT , member of the IBS group
Phone: +7 495 967 8030 Ext. 5619
fields.summary: JIRA doesn't attach images when an issue is created or commented via email.

fields.description:
Greetings from Berlin, Germany!

I had encountered the following Problem, and plea for your *Help*:

due to the some Code-Refactoring taking place now, we have to *move* some _Issues_ from one JIRA-Project to another.
Our Developers use _Subversion_ and comment their _commits_ accordingly (e.g. "MIG-1000"), these are then _visible_ in JIRA-Issues - so far so good.
(While "comitting", our Developers comment the affected JIRA-Issue-ID, for example: "MIG-1000")

The Problem is, after *moving* the _Issues_ from one JIRA-Project to another (e.g. from *MIG* to *MBL*), the "Subversion"-commits aren't displayed anymore,
the Information is *lost*...

Well, the thing is:
- when i move a "MIG"-Issue to be a "MBL"-Issue, later on searching the Issues by its "old" (MIG) Issue-ID, _it can still be found_ in JIRA with its "new" (MBL) Issue-ID

How come the "Subversion"-Plugin can't use the same Information JIRA does and _assign_ the "old" "Subversion"-commit to the new Ticket-ID?

IMHO this is a *serious Problem* which affects our ability to track the Issue-LifeCycle after it had been *moved* to another JIRA-Project getting a new Issue-ID...

It would be great if you could help us out with this Issue,

Cheers,

Alex
fields.summary: "Subversion"-Commit-Information gets lost after moving a Issue from one JIRA-Project to another JIRA-Project

fields.description:
The AttachFile jelly tag documentation needs update as it has a new parameter called created as part of JRA-13654

http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/jelly.html#AttachFile

The changes needed are:
* Add new optional attribute called {{created}} (Please see [CreateIssue's created attribute entry|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/jelly.html#CreateIssue]
* Note that {{key}} & {{filepath}} attributes are required
* Note that {{option}} & {{created}} attributes are optional
* Note in the {{option}} attributes description that if the option is empty string ("") or not provided it will default to "add"
fields.summary: Update AttachFile jelly tag documentation

fields.summary: XLS attachments with russian symbols corrupt

fields.description:
If a custom field is not part of the com.atlassian.jira package then adding searchers does not work. I have a class:

{noformat}
package startrak.jira.plugin.customfields;
public class StarTrakIdCFType extends TextCFType
{noformat}

and define the plugin as below. No exceptions occur in the log, but no searchers are displayed. If I had to bet, I'd guess that somewhere the loading code is mangling the completeKey/Key//package anem combinations and so not finding the class to load. Better logging would have helped to confirm or deny this suspicion.

{noformat}
<atlassian-plugin key="startrak.jira.plugin" name="STARTRAK Plugin">
  <plugin-info>
    <description>Plugin for sending email to STARTRAK.</description>
    <version>1.0.0</version>
    <application-version min="3.5" max="3.11"/>
    <vendor name="Matt Doar, Consulting Toolsmiths" url="http://www.pobox.com/~doar"/>
  </plugin-info>

  <workflow-function key="startrak-workflow-sendmail" name="Send STARTRAK email - workflow" class="startrak.jira.plugin.functions.SendMailFunctionPluginFactory">
    <description>Sends email to related issues in STARTRAK when they change.</description>
    <function-class>startrak.jira.plugin.functions.SendMailFunction</function-class>
    <orderable>false</orderable>
    <unique>true</unique>
    <deletable>true</deletable>
    <weight>900</weight>
    <default>false</default>
    <resource type="velocity" name="view" location="startrak-function-view.vm"/>
  </workflow-function>

  <!-- The .class called by webwork has to be in one of the packages specified in webwork.xml, e.g. com.atlassian.jira.web.action -->
    <webwork1 key="startrak-webwork-sendmail" name="STARTRAK webwork plugin" class="java.lang.Object">
        <description>Send email to STARTRAK</description>
            <actions>
                <action name="issue.StartrakSendMail" alias="StartrakSendMail">
                    <view name="input">/secure/views/plugins/startraksendmail-start.jsp</view>
                    <view name="success">/secure/views/plugins/startraksendmail-start.jsp</view>
                </action>
            </actions>
    </webwork1>

    <customfield-type key="startrakissuefield" name="STARTRAK issues"
        class="startrak.jira.plugin.customfields.StarTrakIdCFType">
        <description>A custom field for STARTRAK issue ids that displays them as links and can track which ones have already been notified of this Jira issue.</description>
        <resource type="velocity" name="view" location="startrak-field-view.vm"/>
        <resource type="velocity" name="edit" location="startrak-field-edit.vm"/>
        <resource type="velocity" name="xml" location="startrak-field-xml.vm"/>
    </customfield-type>

    <customfield-searcher key="textsearcher" name="Free Text Searcher"
        i18n-name-key="admin.customfield.searcher.textsearcher.name"
        class="com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.searchers.TextSearcher">
        <description key="admin.customfield.searcher.textsearcher.desc">Search for values using a free text search.</description>

        <resource type="velocity" name="search" location="templates/plugins/fields/edit-searcher/search-basictext.vm"/>
        <resource type="velocity" name="view" location="templates/plugins/fields/view-searcher/view-searcher-basictext.vm"/>
        <valid-customfield-type package="startrak.jira.plugin.customfields" key="StarTrakIdCFType"/>
    </customfield-searcher>


</atlassian-plugin>
{noformat}
fields.summary: Update documentation to specify how custom field searcher references a custom field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-13713].
  {panel}

Our Jira setup uses a separate Database Server (MySQL), over the past few weeks we have had several failures. In one the whole database became unavailable, and on two more occasions the database went read only (disk full, commits not possible).

While we obviously need to sort out the issues with the database uptime (and contractually it should be 100%, so we have a issue with the provider) we were also disappointed with Jira's behaviour during the outages. [please note: from my perspective as an admin, the logs etc.. were fine, messages were geeky but could be interpreted, and no corruption of the database has occurred].

Our end users, however, were confronted with error pages simply framed the Java exception (in all it's 'glory') no real attempt was made to clarify the situation to the user, just a very complex error message and a note to call the administrators.

In particular, when the dB was read-only, there was no problem viewing issues (which is good) but submitting issues only failed when the user had already entered all their data. Causing much irritation for some who had spent time entering detailed descriptions. Our only choices were to take Jira down altogether, or add a big red announcement banner (tm).

We appreciate that there is no easy technical fix for this, and that there will always be race conditions (Db goes down while user is editing etc..) that are hard to handle, but in situations where Jira relies on an potentially fallible external resource there is an opportunity to provide much more user-friendly error notification.
fields.summary: Better user feedback for database errors

fields.description:
Call to JiraAuthenticationContext.setUser missing during getIssue SOAP service call.
Service call will fail silently if there are custom fields with explicit secutity checking for attributes derived from current user.

In my case I try to verify existance of an issue using getIssue SOAP service which leads to creation of issue object which leads to creation of one paticular customfield where getValuFromIssue fails due to null value in ComponentManager.getComponentInstanceOfType(JiraAuthenticationContext.class)).getUser().

getUser() returns null because user is not set in getIssue Soap service call.
fields.summary: user value of JiraAuthenticationContext not set is SOAP service getIssue()

fields.description:
We are testing to move from 3.6 to 3.10.2
The printable view of the issue navigator (table with filter results) does not show the filter settings anymore at the top of the page as was the case with 3.6. The layout is now (3.10.2 and 3.11) almost the same as the standard view. Did not test this with versions > 3.6 or < 3.10.2
fields.summary: Printer icon on 'Issue Navigator' does not show the Printable View of the issue navigator as it did in JIRA 3.6
Issue Operations Plugin Module documentation out of date

fields.description:
Currently, the most commonly occuring message in the log files on support.atlassian.com is something like this:
{noformat}
2007-08-29 13:55:31,257 JiraQuartzScheduler_Worker-3 ERROR [service.services.mail.MailFetcherService] Throwable: javax.mail.internet.ParseException
javax.mail.internet.ParseException
        at javax.mail.internet.ContentDisposition.<init>(ContentDisposition.java:63)
        at javax.mail.internet.MimeBodyPart.getDisposition(MimeBodyPart.java:900)
        at javax.mail.internet.MimeBodyPart.getDisposition(MimeBodyPart.java:276)
        at com.atlassian.mail.MailUtils.getFirstInlinePartWithMimeType(MailUtils.java:422)
        at com.atlassian.mail.MailUtils.getBodyFromMultipart(MailUtils.java:380)
        at com.atlassian.mail.MailUtils.getBodyFromMultipart(MailUtils.java:406)
        at com.atlassian.mail.MailUtils.getBody(MailUtils.java:117)
        at com.atlassian.jira.service.util.handler.NonQuotedCommentHandler.getEmailBody(NonQuotedCommentHandler.java:41)
        at com.atlassian.jira.service.util.handler.AbstractCommentHandler.handleMessage(AbstractCommentHandler.java:73)
        at com.atlassian.jira.service.util.handler.CreateOrCommentHandler.handleMessage(CreateOrCommentHandler.java:105)
        at com.atlassian.jira.service.services.mail.MailFetcherService.run(MailFetcherService.java:190)
{noformat}

Need to investigate why this occurs so often (> once every minute) to determine if there is some underlying bug in the code.
fields.summary: Investigate the commonly occuring 'service.services.mail.MailFetcherService' messages in the log files on support.atlassian.com
Investigate the commonly occuring 'issue.search.util.LuceneQueryCreator' messages in the log files on jira.atlassian.com

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-13707].
  {panel}

As far as I know Jira has 4 views:
1) All
2) Comments
3) Work History
4) Change History

When I print a Jira Issue it affords me only the information from the Comments view.  QA here would find it a time saver and paper saver to be able to print a combined view that includes Comments and Work History.  Selecting All or Change History are not options because in my workplace we have an extensive workflow which causes the All and Change History view to present many rows of data that are unimportant to us and a waste of paper when printing.
fields.summary: Printing - Allow users to combine the 'Comments' with 'Work Log' when viewing/printing.
